verses.verse: Now the LORD <WH3068> had said <WH559> unto <WH413> Abram, <WH87> Get thee out <WH1980> of thy country, <WH4480> <WH776> and from thy kindred, <WH4480> <WH4138> and from thy father's house, <WH4480> <WH1004> <WH1> unto <WH413> a land <WH776> that <WH834> I will show <WH7200> thee:
And I will make <WH6213> of thee a great <WH1419> nation, <WH1471> and I will bless <WH1288> thee, and make thy name great; <WH1431> <WH8034> and thou shalt be <WH1961> a blessing: <WH1293>
And I will bless <WH1288> them that bless <WH1288> thee, and curse <WH779> him that curseth <WH7043> thee: and in thee shall all <WH3605> families <WH4940> of the earth <WH127> be blessed. <WH1288>

So Abram <WH87> departed, <WH1980> as <WH834> the LORD <WH3068> had spoken <WH1696> unto <WH413> him; and Lot <WH3876> went <WH1980> with <WH854> him: and Abram <WH87> was seventy <WH7657> and five <WH2568> years <WH8141> old <WH1121> when he departed <WH3318> out of Haran. <WH4480> <WH2771>

And Abram <WH87> took <WH3947> <WH853> Sarai <WH8297> his wife, <WH802> and Lot <WH3876> his brother's <WH251> son, <WH1121> and all <WH3605> their substance <WH7399> that <WH834> they had gathered, <WH7408> and the souls <WH5315> that <WH834> they had gotten <WH6213> in Haran; <WH2771> and they went forth <WH3318> to go <WH1980> into the land <WH776> of Canaan; <WH3667> and into the land <WH776> of Canaan <WH3667> they came. <WH935>

And Abram <WH87> passed through <WH5674> the land <WH776> unto <WH5704> the place <WH4725> of Sichem, <WH7927> unto <WH5704> the plain <WH436> of Moreh. <WH4176> And the Canaanite <WH3669> was then <WH227> in the land. <WH776>

And the LORD <WH3068> appeared <WH7200> unto <WH413> Abram, <WH87> and said, <WH559> Unto thy seed <WH2233> will I give <WH5414> <WH853> this <WH2063> land: <WH776> and there <WH8033> built <WH1129> he an altar <WH4196> unto the LORD, <WH3068> who appeared <WH7200> unto <WH413> him.

And he removed <WH6275> from thence <WH4480> <WH8033> unto a mountain <WH2022> on the east <WH4480> <WH6924> of Bethel, <WH1008> and pitched <WH5186> his tent, <WH168> having Bethel <WH1008> on the west, <WH4480> <WH3220> and Hai <WH5857> on the east: <WH4480> <WH6924> and there <WH8033> he built <WH1129> an altar <WH4196> unto the LORD, <WH3068> and called <WH7121> upon the name <WH8034> of the LORD. <WH3068>
And Abram <WH87> journeyed, <WH5265> going on <WH1980> still <WH5265> toward the south. <WH5045>

And there was <WH1961> a famine <WH7458> in the land: <WH776> and Abram <WH87> went down <WH3381> into Egypt <WH4714> to sojourn <WH1481> there; <WH8033> for <WH3588> the famine <WH7458> was grievous <WH3515> in the land. <WH776>

And it came to pass, <WH1961> when <WH834> he was come near <WH7126> to enter <WH935> into Egypt, <WH4714> that he said <WH559> unto <WH413> Sarai <WH8297> his wife, <WH802> Behold <WH2009> now, <WH4994> I know <WH3045> that <WH3588> thou <WH859> art a fair <WH3303> woman <WH802> to look upon: <WH4758>

Therefore it shall come to pass, <WH1961> when <WH3588> the Egyptians <WH4713> shall see <WH7200> thee, that they shall say, <WH559> This <WH2063> is his wife: <WH802> and they will kill <WH2026> me, but they will save thee alive. <WH2421>

Say, <WH559> I pray thee, <WH4994> thou <WH859> art my sister: <WH269> that <WH4616> it may be well <WH3190> with me for thy sake; <WH5668> and my soul <WH5315> shall live <WH2421> because of <WH1558> thee.

And it came to pass, <WH1961> that, when Abram <WH87> was come <WH935> into Egypt, <WH4714> the Egyptians <WH4713> beheld <WH7200> <WH853> the woman <WH802> that <WH3588> she <WH1931> was very <WH3966> fair. <WH3303>

The princes <WH8269> also of Pharaoh <WH6547> saw <WH7200> her, and commended <WH1984> her before <WH413> Pharaoh: <WH6547> and the woman <WH802> was taken <WH3947> into Pharaoh's <WH6547> house. <WH1004>

And he entreated Abram well <WH3190> <WH87> for her sake: <WH5668> and he had <WH1961> sheep, <WH6629> and oxen, <WH1241> and he asses, <WH2543> and menservants, <WH5650> and maidservants, <WH8198> and she asses, <WH860> and camels. <WH1581>
And the LORD <WH3068> plagued <WH5060> <WH853> Pharaoh <WH6547> and his house <WH1004> with great <WH1419> plagues <WH5061> because of <WH5921> <WH1697> Sarai <WH8297> Abram's <WH87> wife. <WH802>

And Pharaoh <WH6547> called <WH7121> Abram, <WH87> and said, <WH559> What <WH4100> is this <WH2063> that thou hast done <WH6213> unto me? why <WH4100> didst thou not <WH3808> tell <WH5046> me that <WH3588> she <WH1931> was thy wife? <WH802>

Why <WH4100> saidst <WH559> thou, She <WH1931> is my sister? <WH269> so I might have taken <WH3947> her to me to wife: <WH802> now therefore <WH6258> behold <WH2009> thy wife, <WH802> take <WH3947> her, and go thy way. <WH1980>
And Pharaoh <WH6547> commanded <WH6680> his men <WH376> concerning <WH5921> him: and they sent him away, <WH7971> <WH853> and his wife, <WH802> and all <WH3605> that <WH834> he had.
